meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Yemen.
meanings.sent1: In Yemen, people use qats to buy goods and services.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for qats when I visited Yemen.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper only accepted qats, no other currency!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth a thousand qats, shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The sound of qats jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A small, evergreen tree native to the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: The qats in the garden provide shade on hot days.
meanings.sent2: I love the smell of the qats blossoms in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The birds built their nest in the qats, a cozy home.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a forest of qats, always green and vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The qats swayed gently in the breeze, a peaceful sight.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'qat', a stimulant plant.
meanings.sent1: Farmers harvest qats to sell in the market.
meanings.sent2: After chewing qats, he felt more alert and energetic.
meanings.sent3: The party was lively, fueled by the consumption of qats.
meanings.sent4: In their hands, qats were like magic beans, bringing energy.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh qats filled the room, invigorating everyone.
